text: I think static analysis becomes more important when there are few unit tests. And that sadly is the problem with a lot of software. What Julia taught me is that I must write small functions and build a good test coverage in order to scale. And to me that’s a good thing.

elements.text: I think static analysis becomes more important when there are few unit tests. And that sadly is the problem with a lot of software. What Julia taught me is that I must write small functions and build a good test coverage in order to scale. And to me that’s a good thing.

text: I wish you could write Rust in a more julian way to be honest. I'm okay with dot composition, and traits but, there's nothing quite like multidispatch and broadcasting...

elements.text: I wish you could write Rust in a more julian way to be honest. I'm okay with dot composition, and traits but, there's nothing quite like multidispatch and broadcasting...

text: You can just have both static analysis and unit tests? Both are good, Rust doesn't make you choose

elements.text: You can just have both static analysis and unit tests? Both are good, Rust doesn't make you choose

text: If  you make Rust more julian enough then you end up with Julia lang :laughing:
